big_picture_notes: 2 Corinthians is an emotionally charged apologia where Paul defends integrity and apostolic authority while seeking reconciliation. The letter coheres through the paradox that divine power is displayed in human weakness (1:3–11; 4:7–12; 12:7–10). Macro‑movement: A) Reconciliation and New‑Covenant ministry (1–7), B) The Jerusalem collection (8–9), C) Polemical defense against the ‘super‑apostles’ (10–13). Literary glue: repeated paraklēsis (comfort/encouragement), boasting redefined as boasting in weakness, peristasis catalogs, and Spirit/new‑covenant contrasts (letter vs Spirit).

stories.story_title: Reconciliation and the Ministry of the New Covenant
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (1:1) epistolary opening and blessing of comfort; end (7:16) resolves anxiety with joy and confidence, closing the reconciliation arc. Glue: comfort/encouragement repetition, weakness→power paradox, and developing defense of new‑covenant ministry (chs. 3–5).

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Salutation to Corinth; comfort repeated as thematic overture (‘so that we can comfort others’). Devices: benediction, repetition (paraklēsis).
Asian affliction near‑death; deliverance elicits prayers and thanksgiving. Devices: narrative disclosure, purpose result (‘so that thanks may be given’).
Conscience testimony; ‘Yes’ in Christ reframes reliability. Devices: apologia, wordplay on Yes/No, Christic faithfulness pivot.

scenes.scene_name: Spirit as Seal and Pastoral Pain
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: God establishes, anoints, seals; delayed visit to spare sorrow; love motive. Devices: covenant seal/arrabōn, pastoral rationale.
Cease excessive punishment; forgive and comfort lest Satan outwit. Devices: imperative counsel, conflict resolution unit.
Troas narrative turns to triumph metaphor; not peddlers but commissioned. Devices: aroma of life/death, anti‑mercenary contrast.

scenes.scene_name: Letter and Spirit; Sufficiency from God
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Corinthians as letter; ministers of new covenant—letter kills, Spirit gives life. Devices: commendation question, letter/Spirit contrast.
Synkrisis of covenants: fading vs permanent glory; unveiled transformation. Devices: a fortiori argument, Moses veil motif, climactic transformation.
Renounce underhanded ways; God shines light (Gen 1:3) in hearts. Devices: negative self‑definition, creation allusion.
Power belongs to God; afflicted/not crushed quatrain; grace→thanksgiving. Devices: paradox, chiastic pairings, doxological aim.
Outer decay/inner renewal; earthly tent vs heavenly building; Spirit as guarantee. Devices: contrast sets, eschatological metaphor, arrabōn.
Courage in exile; persuade; if in Christ—new creation. Devices: legal/political metaphors (ambassadors), new‑creation climax.
God reconciles through Christ; implore: be reconciled; ‘now is the day of salvation’. Devices: embassy appeal, prophetic citation (Isa 49:8).
No stumbling block; peristasis catalog; call for reciprocal openness. Devices: trial catalog, ethos appeal, affectionate address.
Imperative separation; five rhetorical questions; cleanse in holiness. Devices: incompatibility contrasts, promise‑based exhortation.
Make room for us; Titus’ report; worldly vs godly sorrow; confidence restored. Devices: sorrow/joy contrast, narrative resolution inclusio.

stories.story_title: The Collection for the Jerusalem Saints
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (8:1) shifts to the grace of giving; end (9:15) doxology to God’s indescribable gift. Glue: grace/giving/service vocabulary, exemplum of Macedonians, Christological poverty‑riches principle, sowing/reaping metaphor.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Severe test→abundant joy→rich generosity; excel in this grace also. Devices: exemplum, paradox of poverty→liberality.
Not command but proof of love; though rich, became poor; manna equality. Devices: Christological basis, Scripture citation (Ex 16:18).
God’s work in Titus; reputable brothers; prove your love. Devices: commendation formula, integrity emphasis.
Superfluous to write yet necessary; ensure generosity, not grudging. Devices: gentle pressure, preparation logistics.
Sow bountifully; God loves cheerful giver; supplier multiplies seed. Devices: agricultural metaphor, aphorisms, provision promise.
Service supplies needs, produces thanksgiving, proves obedience; doxology. Devices: threefold outcome, climactic thanksgiving.

stories.story_title: Paul’s Defense of His Apostolic Authority
stories.why_start_end_and_literary_glue: Start (10:1) abrupt tonal shift to direct polemic; end (13:14) trinitarian benediction. Glue: boasting redefined, weakness/power antithesis, legal ‘two or three witnesses’ framing for impending visit.

scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Gentleness of Christ with warfare imagery; action will match letters. Devices: military metaphor, warning to opponents.
Reject self‑comparison; boast only in the Lord; approval from God. Devices: irony, Jer 9:24 echo, rule/measure motif.
Bear with ‘foolishness’; betrothal metaphor; not inferior to ‘super‑apostles’. Devices: paternal imagery, serpent deception warning.

scenes.scene_name: Refusal of Support and Unmasked Deceivers
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Free preaching to exalt them; opponents as servants of Satan masquerading. Devices: rhetorical questions, ad hominem exposure.
Forced ‘boast’ in weakness; exhaustive peristasis; basket escape finale. Devices: irony, catalog, climactic anecdote.

scenes.scene_name: Visions, Thorn, and Strength in Weakness
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Paradise vision restrained by thorn; grace suffices; when weak, then strong. Devices: mystical report, paradox thesis.

scenes.scene_name: Signs of a True Apostle and Sincerity
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: Ought to be commended; signs among you; no exploitation. Devices: evidentiary appeal, rhetorical questions.

scenes.scene_name: Final Warnings and Coming in Power
scenes.why_start_end_and_devices: For building up; two or three witnesses; weakness/power pattern in Christ and in us. Devices: legal framing, Christological analogy.
Examine yourselves; Paul’s aim is not severity but building up. Devices: imperative focus shift, purpose statement.
Final imperatives for peace; holy kiss; grace–love–fellowship benediction. Devices: closing formulae, trinitarian blessing.
